1.question: If an object is positively charged, theoretically the mass of the object _________
options: Increases slightly by a factor of 9.11*10-31 kg
Decreases slightly by a factor of 9.11*10-31 kg

2.question: Two equally charged spheres attract each other. Now if they touch each other then they will __________
options: Attract each other with the same amount of force
Attract each other with less amount of force

3.question: Dr. Gilbert tried to hold a brass rod by hand and induce static electricity in it by friction. Why did he fail?
options: Static electricity is induced only on insulators while brass is conducting
The induced static charge flew through his hand and body to the ground
The static charge was not produced at all
It is not possible to induce static electricity by friction

options: Since the electric potential is positive
Since the electric potential is negative
Since the electric potential is zero
Since the outside electric field gets cancelled by the inside electric field

options: Inverse square law is not satisfied

the second one is the electric field formula

18.question: Two conducting spheres of radius r1 = 8 cm and r2 = 2 cm are separated by a distance much larger than 8 cm and are connected by a thin conducting wire. A total charge of Q = +100 nC is placed on one of the spheres. After a fraction of a second, the charge Q is redistributed and both the spheres attain electrostatic equilibrium. Calculate the charge and surface charge density on each sphere.

19.question: A spherical conductor with radius 40cm has a surface charge density of +20 uC/m^2. What is the total charge on this sphere?
